reviews.review: This is the best movie of 2017 by far, the complexity of the characters and the inspiring music are unmatched by any other film.
this movie makes me want to die
Just disliking it because everyone else is. jk I dislike it because it is unoriginal and the fact that it's so cringy made it even worse.
It was better than The Godfather!
Best movie I have ever seen in my lifei

Probably the worst movie I've ever seen. The plot was horrible, the characters don't even look like actual emojis. Please don't take 86 mins out of your day or out of your life to see this movie. Its a waste of money. It's also a shame that this is what movies are coming to now a days.
Sony pictures animation represents everything that's wrong with animated films today! The company is falling apart and this movie, which is more of a failed cash-grab, showcases that.
I've seen a plot like this in like 50 other movies

The worst 'kids' movie in years. Where to even begin?
It's a barebones recycled kids movie story with some of the worst tropes and cliches I've ever seen (Jailbreak is touted as being super feminist but it's all false to get more seats filled), I doubt any of the screenwriters on this have ever actually USED an emoji in real life. If you find the poop emoji funny then...you'll probably like this. That's a really low bar though. And the poop emoji has 5 lines despite being in all the marketing. There's good talent like James Corden in the movie who clearly don't know what animation is like and thought this would be their big break into the animated world. Mel Meh is the most bland, generic character with no personality I've ever seen (despite the whole movie being about how he has ALL the personalities he's a jack of all trades, master of none). 

The worst part is how malicious the advertising is. Twitter, Soundcloud, Dropbox, Spotify, Candy Crush, Just Dance etc, it's one big ploy to get your kids to mindlessly use their phones with several minutes dedicated to trying to sell you the apps like an advert. It is harmful to your kids and malicious because of it.

Ultimately this is a movie that preys on the gullible, the people who will get enjoyment out of pointing at something and going "I know what that is!!!". Don't see this movie, not even ironically, it's just not worth giving them the money for your ticket.
